name: Beloved Community Co-op
description: A Christ-centered, diverse, equitable, and inclusive homeschool cooperative that offers a safe and connected community, a rich and robust education, and radical love to children of all ages and families. They utilize anti-racist curriculum and pedagogy
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: African American Homeschool Network
description: A Facebook community aiming to support, encourage, and promote African American Homeschool families, including curriculum selection and co-op group startup
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: National Black Home Educators (NBHE)
address: Primarily an online resource and national organization, serving Indiana families
description: A resource network founded to encourage, support, and offer fellowship to families exploring home education, with a focus on serving the African American community. They provide information on getting started, networking, and resources
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: Liberated Minds Black Homeschool & African-Centered Education Expo
address: Events are held, but no permanent physical network address listed for Indiana
description: An expo and initiative focused on African-Centered education and homeschooling, founded by Queen Taese
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: Afrocentric Homeschoolers Association (AHA)
description: A discussion group for pro-Black African and/or African Diasporan homeschoolers, unschoolers, and home-based educators
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: African-American Homeschool Moms
description: A blog and Facebook community providing encouragement and resources to Black homeschoolers, with a focus on cultural relevance and support
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: National African-American Homeschoolers Alliance (NAAHA)
description: A nonsectarian organization for African-American home schooling families, aiming to disseminate relevant information and resources
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: Families of Color Utilizing Home Schooling (FOCUHS)
description: A discussion group for Christian families of color who home educate, offering support, fellowship, and resource sharing
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: The Liberated Minds Black Homeschool and Education Association
address: Online presence, associated with Queen Taese
description: An organization focused on the "true" education of youth and families, providing support, guidance, and information with an African-centered perspective
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation

name: EPIC Homeschool Network, Inc.
address: Serves homeschooling families, including those in Indiana, with a focus on supporting homeschoolers of color
description: A network that supports homeschooling families of color by creating individual learning plans and connecting them with educational resources
services: Black-owned Homeschool networks in Indiana consultation
